revised_title: Southern Hemisphere Mesozoic and Tertiary Podocarpaceae and Fagaceae: Palaeogeographic Significance and Distribution
tldr: This article discusses the distribution and significance of Southern Hemisphere Mesozoic and Tertiary Podocarpaceae and Fagaceae, focusing on the role of Nothofagus and podocarp forests in the region's flora. The author examines the fossil records of these plants and their relationship to the present-day forests of New Zealand and South America, providing insights into the phytogeographic and palaeogeographic history of the area.
